result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Daniel St John

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant re bond modification
Preliminary hearing on November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 1:40pm 
Defendant Jacob Daniel St John appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Nelson agrees that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit, as requested by the Defense.  

The Court requires a $250 Cash Bond with conditions:
--not to make any acts or threats of violence
--no contact with any of the witnesses as listed in the Complaint or the Victim Witness Key 
--to maintain absolute sobriety 

Attorney Nelson raises a request in Mr. St. John's case #22CF426 that the preliminary hearing in that case be scheduled within the time limt. 
recess 1:47pm. 

NEXT: (1) clerk- add the Jefferson Public Defenders Office to the mailing matrix,  (2)  Preliminary Hearing on November 15th at 3:30pm in both this case and in Mr. St. John's case #22CF426 [JA-per Judge Dehring, remove the November 18th status -of- counsel hearing in Mr. St. John's other pending cases that was calendared yesterday during Intake; all pending cases should be on the Court's calendar on November 15th at 3:30pm]

Order to Seal Victim Key
The original document was titled: Victim Witness Key
The original history event date is: 11-01-2022
